de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.filterable

Interface ListFilterListener<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the observed adapter's underlying data

    public interface ListFilterListener<DataType>
    Defines the interface, all listeners, which should be notified when the underlying data of a ListAdapter has been filtered, must implement.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onApplyFilter(ListAdapter<DataType> adapter, java.lang.String query, int flags, Filter<DataType> filter, java.util.List<DataType> filteredItems, java.util.List<DataType> unfilteredItems)
      The method, which is invoked, when the adapter's items have been filtered by using a query.
      void onResetFilter(ListAdapter<DataType> adapter, java.lang.String query, int flags, java.util.List<DataType> unfilteredItems)
      The method, which is invoked, when a filter has been reseted.

    • Method Detail

      • onApplyFilter

        void onApplyFilter(@NonNull
                   ListAdapter<DataType> adapter,
                   @NonNull
                   java.lang.String query,
                   int flags,
                   @Nullable
                   Filter<DataType> filter,
                   @NonNull
                   java.util.List<DataType> filteredItems,
                   @NonNull
                   java.util.List<DataType> unfilteredItems)
        The method, which is invoked, when the adapter's items have been filtered by using a query.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The observed adapters as an instance of the type ListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        query - The query, which has been used, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags, which have been used, as an Integer value, or 0, if no flags have been used
        filter - The filter, which has been used to apply the query on the single items, as an instance of the type Filter or null, if the items' implementations of the interface Filterable have been used instead
        filteredItems - A collection, which contains the items, which have been filtered, as an instance of the type List or an empty collection, if no items have been filtered
        unfilteredItems - A collection, which contains the adapter's unfiltered items, as an instance of the type List or an empty collection, if the adapter does not contain any items

      • onResetFilter

        void onResetFilter(@NonNull
                   ListAdapter<DataType> adapter,
                   @NonNull
                   java.lang.String query,
                   int flags,
                   @NonNull
                   java.util.List<DataType> unfilteredItems)
        The method, which is invoked, when a filter has been reseted.
        Parameters:
        adapter - The observed adapters as an instance of the type ListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        query - The query used by the filter, which has been reseted, as a String. The query may not be null
        flags - The flags used by the filter, which has been reseted, as an Integer value or 0, if no flags have been used by the filter
        unfilteredItems - A collection, which contains the adapter's unfiltered items, as an instance of the type List or an empty collection, if the adapter does not contain any items
